definitions.definition: A paragraph or section of text or music with particular meaning.
examples: She struggled to play the difficult passages .

definitions.definition: Part of a path or journey.
examples: He made his passage through the trees carefully, mindful of the stickers.

definitions.definition: The official approval of a bill or act by a parliament . [from 17th c.]
examples: The company was one of the prime movers in lobbying for the passage of the act.

definitions.definition: ( art ) The use of tight brushwork to link objects in separate spatial plains. Commonly seen in Cubist works.
( nautical ) A strait or other narrow waterway .
( caving ) An underground cavity, formed by water or falling rocks, which is much longer than it is wide.
The act of passing ; movement across or through.
The right to pass from one place to another.
A fee paid for passing or for being conveyed between places.
( dice games , historical ) A gambling game for two players using three dice , in which the object is to throw a double over ten . [from 15th c.]

main_definition: A paragraph or section of text or music with particular meaning.
secondary_definitions: Part of a path or journey.
The official approval of a bill or act by a parliament . [from 17th c.]

definitions.definition: A movement in classical dressage , in which the horse performs a very collected, energetic, and elevated trot that has a longer period of suspension between each foot fall than a working trot.

main_definition: ( dressage ) A movement in classical dressage , in which the horse performs a very collected, energetic, and elevated trot that has a longer period of suspension between each foot fall than a working trot.
